titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Albemarle Charlottesville Historical Society MS 553
titlepage.publisher: Albemarle Charlotesville Historical Society. All rights reserved.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Randolph/Hubard Family Collection, MS 553, Albemarle Charlottesville Historical Society

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Randolph and Hubard families are descendants of President Thomas Jefferson through his eldest daughter that survived to adulthood who became a Randolph by marrying her first cousin. Notable properties owned by family members include Tyebrook, Shirley Plantation, Round Top, and Redland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: F1: Photographs(52) of Isa Hubard Ambler, Archie, James Randolph, Aunt Rose and Harriette, other family members, Red Top, Christ Church, Gloucester County, Tyebrook, and Redland.

F2: Correspondence 1939-2014 (90) to: Mrs. (Cecelia) Tom Warring and Mrs. (Isa) Beverely Ambler from: Sally Carter, Mrs, A.H. Snow, A.B. Hubard, Carlotta, Daddy, Isabetta Hubard Ambler, Mrs. J.R. Hubard, Robert Hubard Randolph, Bolling Hubard
Box MS 553- Ephemera a Pocket watch owned by James Hubard with a note from 2011 and a Bible owned by Jamed Hubard
